MDroid has been built with an idea of making it easier to access the contents of Moodle website on native Android UI. 

With over 20+ updates so far MDroid kept getting better and better. 

Currently, the contents are fetched by simply parsing the html strings and it is very unlikely for the app to work with all Moodle servers. 

Please send your suggestions and help me improve the application. 

This is a free and open source application. Support me with a 5-star rating. Refer licensing if you wish to develop upon/using this.

To let the app work with your Moodle server, you first need to point it to your server. \n\nSetting up with your server is very simple. Goto Settings->Set url

To download or open a file just go to the files section and click on the file. If it is not already downloaded, it will be downloaded. To open, click on the downloaded file. \n\nAll files with a green line below the file name are already downloaded
Offline access is given on login screen. This will allow you to open, view or delete the files that you have downloaded before.
Encountered an error while fetching contents.

This occurs when the moodle url you gave is wrong or when there is no Moodle installtion at the given url or when the site is currently down. It is also possible that it is a proxy server or fire wall issue.

Credentials are correct and you logged in successfully. However MDroid couldn\'t detect your name or fetch your courses. This occurs when your Moodle site has been customised (html and/or css changed) and your Moodle server differs from the default setup. MDroid fetches content by parsing html strings and thus doesn\'t work when the moodle site is customised.

Credentials are correct and you logged in successfully. MDroid could detect your name but couldn\'t find any courses. It is possible that there are no courses in your Moodle account or your Moodle site has been customised (html and/or css changed) and your Moodle server differs from the default setup. MDroid fetches content by parsing html strings and thus doesn\'t work when the moodle site is customised.
